content.question: A <math alttext="5.00 microfarads" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>5.00</mtext><mtext> μ</mtext><mtext>F</mtext><mtext></mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> capacitor is connected to a <math alttext="10.0 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>10.0</mtext><mtext> V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> battery until it is fully charged. The charged capacitor is then disconnected from the battery and placed in series with a <math alttext="2.00 millihenrys" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mtext> mH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> inductor and a switch as shown. What is the maximum current in the circuit after the switch is closed?

topic.text: 13.6: Circuits with Capacitors and Inductors (LC Circuits)

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
